text: well we clearly don't know definitely
what is in the North Korean nuclear
arsenal but what they say they tested
today was a hydrogen device a
thermonuclear device this would be
different from the more simpler devices
that they've tested in the past it would
potentially give them a much more
powerful bomb now it has to be said
there's a lot of skepticism about these
North Korean claims but what this test
does show is that North Korea's nuclear
program is still very much in business
and that they have the ambition to
develop it significantly further well
look there are always domestic aspects
to whatever the North Koreans do this is
a means for Kim Jong earned to signal
both North Korea's technical proficiency
but also to signal to his own people
that he is firmly in control and seeing
down all external enemies so that's
important the timing is a little curious
between his new year message and his
official birthday but nonetheless he
will be hoping that this shows that he
is firmly in control of the reins of
power in Pyongyang
well ever since North Korea's first
nuclear test there have been efforts by
the international community to try and
constrain what North Korea is doing
principally by the imposition of
international sanctions the problem is
that this is a very isolated country
there anyway sanctions that really seem
to have worked there's very little
diplomatic leverage that can be applied
China is one of the few countries that
has anything like a close relationship
with North Korea but the North Koreans
don't necessarily listen to Beijing
either there's no chance of course of
military action so I think there's going
to be a lot of concern about this test
because it shows and I think this is the
increasing view of experts that North
Korea's nuclear program isn't just as it
might have been in the past an attempt
to irritate the Americans to wave a big
flag and get attention from the
international community
we may see strengthen sanctions and
there are ways that they could be
tightened up but essentially North Korea
has chosen its path it's eager to gain
an effective nuclear capability and that
is where it is hitting
